question:
With reference to taxation in India, consider the following statements:
1. An ordinary resident is taxed on world-wide income
2. An NRI is taxed only on income received in India
Which among the above is / are correct?
explanation: Taxation varies as follows: Ordinary resident: To be taxed on world-wide income Not-ordinary resident: To be taxed on income sourced from India or received/deemed to be received in India, or from income derived from a business controlled or set up in India Non-resident: To be taxed only on income sourced from India or received/ deemed to be received in India.
